page.title: 04FARMING IN WOODLAND
page.content: We have one hundred acres of{Grass {land.}All the good land goes for hay or silage,The rough land for strip grazing.In winter the silage is fed to the cows.One farmer cultivates rape and turnips for animal feed. All the sheep are on the{Moor}feeding on grass and heather.Before the heather has grown the sheep have to eat the old heather.Gamekeepers burn the heather so that grouse can feed on the young shoots. We have{3 Friesian Bulls,60 Friesian {Cows,}and{Calves}which are followers. One man has a herd of{Friesian}suckler cows and calves. Most of the{Sheep}are{Swaledales}they are tupped by{Leicester tups.}The wether lambs go for meat,gimmers for breeding. A few{Pigs}are kept for bacon,black pudding and sausage.
